oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Country Music Hall of Fame Medallion Ceremony - 2007-05-07 - Harold Bradley, Sonny James, George Strait
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Country Music Hall of Fame medallion ceremony held on May 7, 2007 from the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum's Curb Conservatory. Inductees honored were Harold Bradley, Sonny James,George Strait .
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Vince Gill; Charlie Daniels; Trace Adkins; Reba McEntire; Brenda Lee; Harold Bradley; Connie Smith; the Southern Gentlemen; Randy Owen; Ray Stevens; Porter Wagoner; Sonny James; Dean Dillon; Lee Ann Womack; Alan Jackson; George Jones; George Strait;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Welcome by Kyle Young -- Comments from E.W Wendell -- "Drifting Too Far From The Shore" Vince Gill -- Harold Bradley segment "Thanks A Lot" Charlie Daniels -- "Hello Darling" Trace Adkins -- "I Fall To Pieces" Reba McEntire -- Brenda Lee with the presentation of medallion to Harold Bradley -- Comments from Harold Bradley -- "Lara's Theme" Harold Bradley -- Sonny James segment -- "A World Of Our Own" Connie Smith and the Southern Gentlemen -- "Your The Only World I Know" Randy Owen and the Southern Gentlemen -- "Young Love" Vince Gill with the Southern Gentlemen -- "Running Bear" Ray Stevens and the Southern Gentlemen -- Porter Wagoner with the presentation of medallion to Sonny James -- Sonny James comments -- George Strait segment -- "The Chair" Dean Dillon -- "The King Of Broken Hearts" Lee Ann Womack -- "The Fireman" Alan Jackson -- George Jones with the presentation of medallion to George Strait -- comments from George Strait -- "Amarillo By Morning" George Strait - "Will The Circle Be Unbroken" assembled Country Music Hall of Fame members
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Gill, Vince; Daniels, Charlie, 1936-;Adkins, Trace; McEntire, Reba; Bradley, Harold; Smith, Connie, 1941-; Southern Gentlemen (Musical group); Owen, Randy, 1949-; Gill, Vince; Stevens, Ray, 1939-; Wagoner, Porter; Dillon, Dean; Womack, Lee Ann; Jackson, Alan, 1957-; Jones, George, 1931-2013; Strait, George, 1952-;
